intro: Manettia ignita var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf manettia, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
